page_analysis.text_content:
Parking

Parking space standards

Parking regulations af-
fect the appearance of
the streetscapes in our
residential neighbor-
hoods by minimizing
the number of cars
parked on the street
and in the front yards
by requiring that there
are parking spaces
available deeper into
the lot.

• Two spaces are required on the lot (per
dwelling).

• They may NOT be located in the
required front yard or, first 10 ft of,
required street side yard.

• 2nd dwelling units have same require-
ments.

• No underground parking garages except
by variance.

• One of the two spaces must be covered.

• To be considered detached, a covered-
parking structure must be a minimum of
3' from the main dwelling.

• Minimim size for an uncovered space is
8.5' x 18'.

• Minimum clearance inside a covered
parking structure to be 10' x 20' for
each space. Therefore, a two-car garage
or carport to be 20' x 20' clear inside.

• Minimum vertical clearance: 7'.

* Clear area for parking space must be free
of other uses e.g., water heaters, clothes
washers or dryer, bicycle parking facili-
ties, etc.

visual_elements.description: Figure 28: Parking space dimensions for garage and uncovered space in plan view. It shows two parking spaces in a vertical arrangement. The top space is a 'Required covered space' with a car parked inside, indicating a minimum inside clearance of 10' (width) and 20' (length). The bottom space is a '2nd space (uncovered) Tandem OK' with a car parked inside, indicating a minimum uncovered space of 8.5' (width) and 18' (length). Both spaces are depicted with a top-down view of a car.
visual_elements.location: Right side of the page, spanning from top to bottom

sections: Parking regulations affect the appearance of the streetscapes in our residential neighborhoods by minimizing the number of cars parked on the street and in the front yards by requiring that there are parking spaces available deeper into the lot.
• Two spaces are required on the lot (per dwelling).
• They may NOT be located in the required front yard or, first 10 ft of, required street side yard.
• No underground parking garages except by variance.
• One of the two spaces must be covered.
• To be considered detached, a covered-parking structure must be a minimum of 3' from the main dwelling.
• Minimim size for an uncovered space is 8.5' x 18'.
• Minimum clearance inside a covered parking structure to be 10' x 20' for each space. Therefore, a two-car garage or carport to be 20' x 20' clear inside.
* Clear area for parking space must be free of other uses e.g., water heaters, clothes washers or dryer, bicycle parking facilities, etc.

additional_notes: The page number '34' is present at the bottom left.
The left column with 'Parking' heading and descriptive text is shaded grey.
Asterisks (*) are used as bullet points for some regulations and also as a visual marker in the diagram.
